greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Leading diagonal of triangle A119446, as described in A100461, except with a(1,n) = prime(n) instead of 2^(n-1).
comment: a(181) = 27 is the first term greater than 19. This is because prime(181)/181 > 6 for the first time. In general this sequence is determined by prime(n)/n: the pattern for each row of the triangle is that it ends with prime(n), preceded by multiples of k = prime(n)/n down to k^2, then the largest multiple of k-1 less than k^2 and the largest multiple of k-2 less than that and so on. This sequence gives the multiple of 1. See A000960 for the sequence that gives the ending value for each starting k.
xref: Cf. A100461 for powers of 2, A119444 for Fibonacci and A119446 for triangle corresponding to this diagonal.
results.author: _Joshua Zucker_, May 20 2006
